page.title: 08NATURAL HISTORY
page.content: There are many animals and plants in a nature area called{Castle Eden Walkway The Walkway used to be an old railway and the station house is now a Field Centre.The{ecology}of this Walkway area is affected by the fact that it was once a{railway.}Steep embankments, non-indigenous plant seed dispersal and carbon deposits from steam trains have all helped to produce a peculiar environment to study.There are three environments at Castle Eden Walkway- 1.The Walkway itself 2.The woods where badgers live and 3.A pond where water life is abundant.In addition the woods provide a refuge for many species of birds and heavy undergrowth on the sides of embankments create breeding grounds for butterflies. The open farmland also provides suitable conditions for rabbits and hares and kestrels have been spotted.
